RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a spire.
Two Nomai debated about the Sun Station while waiting outside this warp tower, hoping to travel to something called the Deep Storm Station.
The Deep Storm Station is only accessible from a new warp pad constructed on the Construction Yard.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin in the shape of a mountain.
A Nomai named Cycad delivered a message to Oeno on Timber Hearth, informing them about an issue with the towers.
After studying the issue, Oeno suggested traveling to the other tower with the same issue to better demonstrate her findings.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles a basalt column.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin that resembles a basalt column.

RumorFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.

ExploreFact.Text: A tower on Ash Twin with pointed edges.
The Ash Twinâ€™s rotating doors can be activated by a phenomenon called the sunless tide.

The sunless tide occurs as the Hourglass Twins align directly with the sun, causing a combined force of gravity that causes sand to be pulled in a column, and vision orbs to be pulled, towards the twin closer to the sun.
As this alignment occurs, a solar eclipse occurs on the body farther from the sun.

RumorFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.

ExploreFact.Text: Two towers on Ash Twin joined together by an arch.
